intro: Anodendron wrayi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically produces tubular or bell-shaped blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Anodendron wrayi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
